benchmark_details.name: MEDQA (Medical Question Answering Dataset)
benchmark_details.overview: MEDQA is the first open-domain multiple-choice question answering dataset for solving medical problems, collected from professional medical examinations. It requires extensive medical knowledge to answer complex questions.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a challenging open-domain question answering dataset for the medical field that can advance research in natural language understanding and comprehension.

data.source: Questions collected from medical board exams in the USA, Mainland China, and Taiwan.
data.size: 12,723 English questions, 34,251 simplified Chinese questions, 14,123 traditional Chinese questions

methodology.calculation: Metrics are determined based on the percentage of correct answers among the provided options.
methodology.interpretation: Higher accuracy indicates better performance in answering medical questions.
methodology.baseline_results: Current state-of-the-art methods achieve 36.7%, 42.0%, and 70.1% accuracy on English, traditional Chinese, and simplified Chinese questions, respectively.
methodology.validation: Through experiments and evaluation by medical experts.
